intro: Ixia fallax, commonly known as the yellow ox-eye, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a prominent central bloom. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 cm and produces trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Ixia fallax thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and ease of cultivation.
